item.title: New Ratchet & Clank Game Announced, But It‚Äôs A Mobile Shooter Thing
item.content:encoded:
Good news: Sony just announced a new Ratchet & Clank game. Bad news: It‚Äôs some free-to-play mobile arena shooter thing.

On November 12, PlayStation Studios and Insomniac announced Ratchet & Clank: Ranger Rumble. The game is being created by OhBibi, a mobile game developer located in France which has previously created cartoony, colorful action-focused third-person shooters. And what do you know, that‚Äôs exactly what Ranger Rumble appears to be in the game‚Äôs first trailer.

According to the upcoming game‚Äôs website, Ranger Rumble will feature ‚Äúiconic characters from the Ratchet & Clank franchise‚Äù as well as big guns and explosions, which are hallmarks of the long-running series that started back on the PS2. PlayStation Studios describes Ranger Rumble as a ‚Äúfast-paced multiplayer platformer arena shooter,‚Äù which, yeah, seems accurate.

‚Äú‚ÄãExperience the humor, action, and energy of the iconic universe in a bold new real-time multiplayer format,‚Äù says the game‚Äôs website. ‚ÄúPlay as a Legendary Hero from the past, now with unique abilities. Go solo or team up with other Rangers online in thrilling multiplayer games built for every kind of player.‚Äù

No release date was announced, but it is supposedly coming to mobile platforms ‚Äúsoon.‚Äù You can pre-register now.

I think visually, Ranger Rumble looks great. It feels like a Saturday morning cartoon spin on the Ratchet & Clank universe, and I‚Äôm here for that. However, I‚Äôve tried multiple times to enjoy multiplayer shooters on mobile phones using touch controls, and I hate it. And sure, many of them let you plug in a controller and play that way, but at that point, I‚Äôd rather just play a game on PC or console. Perhaps Ratchet & Clank: Ranger Rumble will eventually make the leap to PS4/PS5 and PC, but for now, I‚Äôm not sure I‚Äôll play it. At least Sony hasn‚Äôt forgotten about Ratchet & Clank. So that‚Äôs nice!

This also lines up with past comments from former PlayStation CEO Jim Ryan, who in 2021 explained in investor relations documents that Sony was looking to invest more in mobile games based on famous franchises. I can‚Äôt wait for the Sly Cooper match-three game.
